author: Andrew Shuster
title: 'Biggest Loser' host Bob Harper reveals he had a heart attack
text:
'Biggest Loser' host Bob Harper reveals he had a heart attack Gossip Cop 13 hrs ago Andrew Shuster Click to expand Replay Video Storm chasers pay homage to late ‘Twister’ star Bill Paxton Members of the weather community celebrated the late Bill Paxton for his starring role in ‘Twister,’ by spelling out his initials on radar by using GPS coordinates. Paxton died from complications from surgery. He was 61 FOX News Celebrities Freak Out Over Oscars' Flub That Could Have Been Avoided Hollywood’s biggest night gave us quite the ending. But could it have been avoided? Yes! Susana Victoria Perez (@susana_vp) has more. Buzz60 Watch: Best Picture mix-up on stage Faye Dunaway and Warren Beatty presented "La La Land" as the winner of the best picture award, and the celebration began on stage but was quickly ended when one of the "La La Land" winners pointed out that in fact "Moonlight" had won the award. Online See more videos SHARE SHARE TWEET SHARE EMAIL What to watch next Storm chasers pay homage to late ‘Twister’ star Bill Paxton FOX News 1:35 Celebrities Freak Out Over Oscars' Flub That Could Have Been Avoided Buzz60 1:10 Watch: Best Picture mix-up on stage CNN 1:02 Watch Jimmy Kimmel Tweet at Donald Trump During the Oscars Time 0:47 Celebrities React to Viola Davis’ Oscar Win Time 2:28 Here’s Why Stars Are Wearing Blue Ribbons at the Oscars Time 3:01 Jimmy Kimmel Roasted 'the Highly Overrated' Meryl Streep at the Oscars Time 0:17 Is An Oscar Really Worth Only $1?! Money 1:28 How stars prepare for awards shows CNN 1:07 Actors reveal first jobs in Hollywood CNN 1:41 Oscar nominees get political CNN 1:16 What to expect at the 89th Academy Awards CNN 1:46 16 Things You Need to Know About the Oscars Wired 1:23 Could you afford to go to the Oscars? Money 1:27 Ed Sheeran and Taylor Swift's Cutest BFF Moments Instyle 1:05 Rihanna Named Harvard University's Humanitarian of the Year Veuer 0:50 UP NEXT “The Biggest Loser” host Bob Harper suffered a heart attack earlier this month that left him unconscious for two days, it was revealed Monday. Fortunately, the personal trainer is now awake and on the mend.
Harper reportedly collapsed while working out a New York City gym, resulting in a doctor at the facility administering CPR and a defibrillator to try and resuscitate him.
According to TMZ , the fitness instructor was rushed to a nearby hospital, where he remained unconscious for two days until waking up.
Harper was hospitalized for a total of eight days, and remains in New York City on doctor’s orders as he’s yet to be cleared to fly home to Los Angeles. Harper later revealed that the condition is genetic, and his mom died from a heart attack.
Last year, Harper took over the hosting duties of “The Biggest Loser” from Alison Sweeney. © NBC THE BIGGEST LOSER -- Season: 16 -- Pictured: Bob Harper -- (Photo by: Chris Haston/NBC) Thursdays on NBC (8-9 pm ET)
The fitness trainer is much beloved for being tough, yet being kind to the contestants. Harper even came out as gay in 2013 on the weight-loss competition show to help one of the contestants, Bobby Salem, who was struggling with telling his own father he was gay.
Harper revealed on the episode to Saleem, “I’m gay. I knew a very long time ago that I was gay,” adding, “But being gay doesn’t mean being weak. Being gay doesn’t mean that you are less than anybody else. It’s just who you are.”
